definition: role of vivacious young female in Chinese opera
flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful
dawn/morning/daybreak/day/dan, female roles in Chinese opera (traditionally played by specialized male actors)

sentences.english: The Qingyi and Huadan will sing without microphone.
Li Peng has worked for Hua Dan for over a year.
sentences.chinese: 李鵬在花旦公司已經工作了一年多。

sentences.english: Hua Dan has already received a great deal of support for its relief efforts in Sichuan.
sentences.chinese: 花旦在四川的救援項目已經得到了大力支持。

sentences.english: AC Milan and Real Madrid are battling for River Plate sensation Gonzalo Higuain.
sentences.chinese: AC米蘭與皇馬爭奪河牀的當家花旦伊瓜因。

sentences.english: The last few months have really shown the need for Hua Dan's type of work in Sichuan.
sentences.chinese: 過去幾個月的確顯示了四川地區對花旦工作的需要。

sentences.english: Provide leadership in extending the reach and impact of Hua Dan's services.
sentences.chinese: 擴大花旦的影響範圍，提升品牌價值。

definition: currently popular (of movie stars, singers etc)
dan, female roles in Chinese opera (traditionally played by specialized male actors)
young unmarried lady role in Chinese opera
(neologism c. 2014) celebrity with a huge, devoted fan base/celebrity with a huge following on social media
erhua variant of 名角[ming2 jue2]
